channel.title: [In Progress] Zybez 07Scape Price Guide Project [Updated at 08/08/2013;9:47am]
channel.description:
It's been a while since I've posted in the website development section, but, here I am. I took a looong leave on the 'technology world' and it felt good, and helped me realize a lot of things. But, I'm back, and here's my first project/release since. A lot of people want a price guide to help their economy for private servers, and Zybez does a wonderful job on doing so, except it does so for Runescape 2007. So hey, why not bring it to private servers for everyone to enjoy? For those of you who don't know what Zybez is, it's a Runescape help site. They did a wonderful job on having a price guide that anyone can post on, for others to read, and contact them to buy their item. It's an amazing system, so I figured I would work on bringing it to the RSPS world, for all to use. If you want to look at a live view of Zybez's Price Guide, go here: [url=http://forums.zybez.net/runescape-2007-prices]http://forums.zybez.net/runescape-2007-prices[/url] Thanks everyone, let me know what you think of the idea.
To do: [code]- Get HTML/CSS/Images *DONE* - Clean HTML/CSS *DONE* - Start on some of the base PHP scripts and databases *DONE* - Create scripts to calculate average buy/sell value of an item - Add base items most commonly sold on private servers - Link images from items - Possibly create graphs - Administration page to collect data on most purchased item, etc. [/code]
Update Log: [code][08/08/2013;8:51am] - Working on cleaning the HTML/CSS and other un-needed parts of the site. [08/08/2013;9:47am] - I've finished cleaning the HTML and CSS, now working on importing images, then PHP. [08/08/2013;11:12am] - Just finished setting up the databases and tables, with columns and rows. Made it so that when you go to view a specific item, it reads information from the database. And accurately displays past offers. Next is working on display average sell, buy, etc. [/code] [size=14pt]Images[/size]
[08/08/2013;9:47am] - Everywhere you see 'server' can be changed in settings.php to your server name. [IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/ftgdfq.png[/img]

item.title: [In Progress] Zybez 07Scape Price Guide Project [Updated at 08/08/2013;9:47am]
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Samih1996:

Looks like good work, I just don’t understand why everyone is mad about him using the stylesheets from Zybes. The design isn’t even impressive and looks like it was release open source the stylesheets.

Thanks for backing me up. Come release day, I’m going to have two downloads, one including the Zybes stylesheets and layout, and one with it all stripped.

Read full topic

item.title: [In Progress] Zybez 07Scape Price Guide Project [Updated at 08/08/2013;9:47am]
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Muroth:

IMO only servers that have hundreds of players would need this. It’s a great project to help better yourself in the long run. Just keep using the template until you’re ready to release it, then strip it when you do.

Most likely what I’m going to do. And it’ll be best for servers that have at least 80 people. But it can work with those that have 30-40.

item.title: [In Progress] Zybez 07Scape Price Guide Project [Updated at 08/08/2013;9:47am]
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Pwnd:

We should all stop complaining, especially while he doesn’t have any server sided code working.

How can you say I don’t have any server sided code working? Do you mean server-sided in terms of PHP or SQL? If that’s the case, I’ve got plenty done. It’s reading the items from the database, calculating averages perfectly, displaying top 10 recent offers, and a few more scripts.

  • If you’re talking about server-sided in terms on Java, this doesn’t require any.

** For all of those who are complaining about me not using my own design, I’ll scratch the Zybez design and release just the PHP/SQL with minimal HTML/CSS. It’ll be very simple so people can easily add it to their website’s theme. A simple PHP call to a function in the location you want it, and you’re done. For example:

To call the item search:

Code for itemSearch function:

function itemSearch() { //PHP code to display the item search bar. }

I will have other functions for different things as well.

getRecent(); - Gets the 10 most recent purchases. newOffer(); - Displays the form to make a new offer. playerOffers($playerName); - Shows the users previous offers. Can find them by player name, if they are logged in and you carry the session over, or by a browser cookie, or even IP.

Will update with progress soon.

Read full topic
item.source: [In Progress] Zybez 07Scape Price Guide Project [Updated at 08/08/2013;9:47am]

item.title: [In Progress] Zybez 07Scape Price Guide Project [Updated at 08/08/2013;9:47am]
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

I really think you should of done the design yourself.

I rather use my forum for something like this and have them sell/buy items through a thread or implement grand exchange. For the whole pricing guide I would prefer to do it all within server or create a page with rough guidelines.

The php/sql seems really easy for something that you are doing.

Read full topic
item.source: [In Progress] Zybez 07Scape Price Guide Project [Updated at 08/08/2013;9:47am]

item.title: [In Progress] Zybez 07Scape Price Guide Project [Updated at 08/08/2013;9:47am]
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I have a lot of respect for you, AJ, but you’re in the wrong here. A lot of the people on this thread are actually nothing to do with the RSPS scene and could care less where it goes so why does that matter? RSC Shadow is one of the most talented website developers I know so if I was you I’d really take more of an interest in his opinion and take on board his criticism. You say you’re trying to progress the RSPS community but you won’t take any criticism on a big idiotic thing that you’re doing. You really should know better. If you release this with that CSS then zybez take offence all you’re doing is getting everyone who uses it into shit.

Read full topic
item.source: [In Progress] Zybez 07Scape Price Guide Project [Updated at 08/08/2013;9:47am]

item.title: [In Progress] Zybez 07Scape Price Guide Project [Updated at 08/08/2013;9:47am]
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:18, topic:527399”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=646149.msg4346912#msg4346912 date=1376015292]

[quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=646149.msg4346909#msg4346909 date=1376013214]

[quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=646149.msg4346840#msg4346840 date=1376003976]

[quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=646149.msg4346836#msg4346836 date=1376003306]

Why would you rip their CSS?

Why not? I’m doing the PHP and SQL for it, not going to create a different template, there’s no need.
[/quote]I don’t believe they gave you permission to use it.

These whole forums and the entire RSPS community is based off projects and releases that no one received permission to do. As Rodgerwilco said, who cares about permission? You expect everyone to ask permission before doing something? You’re starting to sound like Lamar S. Smith (sponsor of SOPA.) If you’re going to complain about me not using my own template, simply go away. I could have created one if I wanted, but this is meant to be a quick project, and I’m just doing the PHP/SQL.
[/quote]By ripping others’ templates without their permission, it gives the impression that you’re lazy and incompetent. I don’t care if you’re doing it because it’s a “quick project”. If that’s the case, then use a CSS framework or write something basic. It isn’t about legalities (although it could be), it’s about respecting other peoples’ hard work.

I’m not taking credit for some else’s hard work at the bottom of the page I added, “Template (Including HTML/CSS) created by Zybez | Slightly modified by The Web Guy.” With ‘Zybez’ being a hyperlink to the original price look up. Underneath that line in the footer it states, “PHP/MySQL done by The Web Guy.”

**If you don’t want to support my development, and just want to accuse me of ‘not respecting others hard work’ or ‘being lazy’ I’m asking you nicely to just stop posting on my development thread. You’re clearly just trying to start an argument for absolutely no reason, aside from the fact you just like to argue. You comment on a majority of my developments just trying to start arguments with me, honestly? Please, just grow up.
[/quote]If you think you can post here and receive nothing but praises and compliments, perhaps you should refrain from posting. I’m not trying to start arguments, I asked a question and criticized you for your actions.

I know, it’s Moparscape, full of immature people who feel the need to act like little kids.
[/quote]If that’s how you feel then I don’t see why you bother posting here.[/quote]

Because, there are those select few people who actually like to see the RSPS community progress forward, and provide positive feedback to those trying to progress it. Everyone else seems to be a troll, has nothing nice to say, or is here just because they don’t know how to run their server.

Read full topic
item.source: [In Progress] Zybez 07Scape Price Guide Project [Updated at 08/08/2013;9:47am]

item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:6, topic:527399”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=646149.msg4345666#msg4345666 date=1375839457]

[quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=646149.msg4345643#msg4345643 date=1375836629]
Why would you rip their CSS?
[/quote]he never makes his own templates. Just takes others and modifies it.
[/quote]I wouldn’t see a problem with this if the original authors gave permission or released their work under a free licence.[/quote]It’s just lazy, regardless. I feel it stems the need to be unoriginal and limited to what they have.
